doc.field: Records of the Alternative Media Center and Interactive Telecommunications Program, Tisch School of the Arts
Records of the Alternative Media Center and Interactive Telecommunications Program, Tisch School of the Arts

Adjacent is an online journal published by the Interactive Telecommunications Program at NYU. The first issue was published in September 2017. The journal focuses on emerging interactive media and research and analysis on contemporary issues. Topics include bias in algorithms, "tech-enabled apophenia," machine learning libraries, feminism, simulations, colonialism, resistance, COVID-19, feelings, disembodiment, and ritual.
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored. Scope was expanded to include Google documents and YouTube and Vimeo videos.

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
